results.title: Electric Fields
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Discusses an electric field as a mathematical aid and as a physical entity. Experiments demonstrate the vector addition of fields, the shielding effect by closed metallic surfaces and the electric force which drives an electric current in a conductor.

results.title: Elastic collisions and stored energy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the concept of stored energy. Uses the example of collisions between two dry-ice pucks. Cylindrical magnets are mounted on the pucks, producing a repelling force, and the kinetic energy of the pucks is measured. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.

results.title: Coulomb's law
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
Demonstrates the inverse square relationship between electric force and distance and shows that electric force is directly proportional to charge.

results.title: Behavior of gases
results.creator_credit: John Friedman, Gene Kearney, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PSSC physics”.
The Brownian motion as applicable to smoke particles is shown by photomicrography and compared with a mechanical analogue. Animation is used to develop a model for gas pressure based on chaotic molecular motion. This chaotic motion is contrasted with the orderly behaviour of gases as shown by an experiment illustrating Boyle’s Law. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Friedman, Gene Kearney, Lee Grodzins and Educational Services Incorporated

results.title: Protecting Our Greatest Asset
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

group_works.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset

results.title: Conservation tillage protecting our greatest asset
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Protecting Our Greatest Asset”.
It should be noted that this video is made by a chemical company that manufactures herbicides. Intensive cropping and continual cultivation stresses the Australian soil dramatically. This video looks at alternative methods to soil tillage by machinery, namely herbicides. Crops which require no tillage as conservation are also discussed.

results.title: Problems of World Order
results.brief_description: Each program looks at a problem or development which has implications for the whole world and which can only be solved through international cooperation. The divide between the rich and the poor nations of the world is highlighted.

results.title: Communication satellites
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems of World Order”.
Explores the world implications of sophisticated ommunication facilities, particularly with respect to technologically advanced and underdeveloped countries. Focuses on control problems of potential power of the Intersat and the Comsat. Suitable for upper secondary level.

group_siblings.title: Cultural heritage
group_siblings.creator_credit: Jeremy Murray-Brown and Visnews

results.title: Cultural heritage
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Problems of World Order”.
Tourism is now a giant worldwide industry providing an important source of revenue. This film shows how much of the heritage that we flock to see is being destroyed by tourism, modern technology and pollution. Discusses who should bear the cost and responsibility of this, using examples.

results.title: Problems of conservation
results.brief_description: Highlights problems in the United States associated with the depletion of non-renewable natural resources; forest, mineral, wildlife and the associated problem of increasing air pollution. Discusses intervention strategies.
